title: New goto app for me
text:

title: Why the massive change?
text: I used Arrive for months to help keep my shipments in order, and with the ability to rename shipments and properly designate them, Arrive was my solution. Recently I see it automatically updated to the new ‚ÄúShop‚Äù app, and the convenience went out the window. I can no longer name my shipments or know which tracking number is for which items, now my screen is filled with ‚Äú1 Item‚Äù, ‚Äú2items‚Äù notifications which is less helpful than navigating to the individual apps to look up the tracking information for specific items. Fix these issues quick or I‚Äôm definitely deleting the ‚Äúnew and improved‚Äù app that force-downloaded it‚Äôs way into my phone.

title: What is this?
text:
I've had multiple services recommend using this app to keep track of shipments, especially when other methods of tracking aren't directly available. To that end, it *kinda* does the job. But wow, it is unreliable beyond uselessness.

For instance, I have two deliveries that I received from Etsy and a musician's website respectively, one entry claims that its package is in transit while the other claims its is out for delivery.... both packages were delivered months ago. 

I got another package from Razer a while later, which it currently says was delivered... twice. Additionally, it still says that its waiting for the package details.

Another recent purchase of mine did not get a Shop entry for a day or two after I ordered, at which point it said that it was to arrive the next day, even though it didn't have the UPS shipping info. After a couple days, I got a new notification saying the same thing: arrives tomorrow, no shipping info. An item I ordered simultaneously just got delivered today with a Shop notification despite it never even showing up in my order list before.

I've received packages from DHL, UPS, FedEx, and a few third party vendors, but none of them have failed to stump this app. I really don't know where all the positive reviews are coming from. This is useless.

title: The app I never knew I always needed
text: Wow- I didn‚Äôt realize that I find it extremely annoying to have to dig thru my emails to find shipping notices for various items I have ordered. But it turns out I find it bothersome, tedious and annoying. Especially considering that I get about 509 useless emails daily that I have to sift thru to find the one shipping email I want. This is a fabulous app that actually improves a small part of my daily life. If you order tons of stuff online (as most people in 2019 do) I highly recommend this app. You will know where all of your packages are and exactly when they will be at your front door!

title: What happened??
text:
This app was great. Now it‚Äôs showing every purchase I‚Äôve made through a Shop website and they‚Äôre all listed as ‚Äúshipped‚Äù instead of delivered, even years old purchases, and they‚Äôre all on top of actual recent orders that I‚Äôm tracking. There used to be a quick slide option for items in the list to mark as delivered, and that feature is gone now. To mark as delivered requires opening what appears to be every single order I‚Äôve ever placed through Shop. There‚Äôs a pretty big time delay (multiple hours) between when a package is marked as delivered through a carrier‚Äôs website and when it‚Äôs marked on the app, which is kind of annoying. 
One star for pulling things automatically from shop **for new purchases** and one star for allowing me to add other tracking numbers from anywhere.

title: One of the best apps on my phone!!
text: I have a few similar type apps that help see where your package and when delivery is scheduled, but NONE come NEAR this awesome app, that also includes a shop option so it has the information from the get-go. Their updates are more timely and correct than those from USPS and FedEx- ESPECIALLY for delivery, which I used to have just sitting there on my doorstep in a place where package grabbing is a problem. I have not had that worry since the day I got this app!  I‚Äôm so super pleased in every way for this. I just really wanted to give it the appreciation it deserves- awesome job guys, I‚Äôm so thrilled with all aspects that come with this app, and for the help keeping my orders straight and in one place!!

title: HATE 2.63.0 new UI
text:
This was a fantastic app for keeping track of my orders from various sources all in one place! And ONLY for keeping track of my orders. I do not want to be forced to navigate to a separate tab to see all of my orders in the same place. I do not want to be shown which ‚Äúshops you love‚Äù or be recommended new shops. I know well where I am a repeat customer and what new products or sales they have and I‚Äôm absolutely not using the Shop app to shop, only to keep track of what‚Äôs on its way to me. Aside from the User Interface suddenly being godawful, this update is continually having connectivity problems. 

I hope you bring back the old version of the Orders page in the future, or even add an option in Settings to disable recommendations/re-enable the old Orders tab‚Äî I absolutely loved the way it was set up!

title: Latest update ruins a good app
text:
Don‚Äôt know what happened, but after running the latest update the interface has completely changed. My seller has the integrated Shop experience and shipped my order almost immediately. In the past the experience was seamless; the Shop
App would update automatically and it was easy to see the tracking status. Now it‚Äôs basically just an advertisement and a flashy version of my email confirmation and listing of purchased items, with nothing more than added marketing for the seller. Tracking is gone; I can‚Äôt even see the tracking numbers or carrier from Shop, I have to go dig up another random sellor email for that. And this was an integrated shop experience, not a manual add to the app?! You‚Äôve ruined what was a nice app I found useful. I‚Äôll be taking it off my phone but then I‚Äôm stuck in this useless loop all over again with the next seller who uses shop :( very disappointing!

title: Quick response
text: I felt the quality of service I got from this website was way better than I was expecting and deserves a good review. I didn‚Äôt realize that they are only open 3 days of the week (Tue-thur) to ship out orders. title: Great app but could use some extra stuff
text:
I tend to order a lot of things and check their tracking numbers obsessively. Normally I‚Äôd just look them up in my email and check them every day or so, so this app is great for putting all of orders together so I can go to one spot and check them all. It even shows you their locations on a map!

But I wish it was a little better. My only real gripe with it is that the tracking number it shows under your order isn‚Äôt a link. So when I have problems with my orders and for some reason they‚Äôre taking longer than normal to be sent out or delivered to the postal office, I can‚Äôt click on the tracking number and be instantly taken to the site for verification. Otherwise though, it‚Äôs a great app and I can‚Äôt wait for other sites to start using it

title: Suffered a bad update.
text:
I used to LOVE Arrive, but a recent UI overhaul also seems to have hit the functionality pretty bad. Fist of all, I can no longer see maps of where my items are upon opening the app ‚Äì you have to click on the item to find out where your package is. There‚Äôs not even a note about it on the items card, so you can‚Äôt just view package locations quickly anymore. 

Second, updates on package locations and statuses seem to take MUCH longer now. It used to be crazy accurate, and I was really impressed, but now I almost don‚Äôt trust it, because I get different information when I go straight to USPS‚Äô or UPS‚Äô website with my tracking numbers. I just got a notification that a package of mine is still on track to arrive in two days... I received that package a week ago. And it‚Äôs tracking number reflects that, so I‚Äôm not sure why Arrive wouldn‚Äôt. 

Used to be an A+ app, but I‚Äôm really disappointed now.

title: Needs Improvement
text: I thought Shop was trustworthy as they are connected with another company I use. When they gave me shop cash to use, I thought I‚Äôd give them a try.  I found a product I wanted and ordered. Nowhere did it say the item was shipping from China. The estimated time for delivery it gave me was within 2 weeks (ordered Nov 30.) When the order shipped a few days later it updated to show it won‚Äôt arrive until Dec 17-21. Now (Dec 19) it‚Äôs showing it failed to clear customs. All of this happens with online shopping, but other platforms have the option to review the shop. If Shop is going to have companies on its platform, it needs to have a way of vetting them, and reviewing them, and reporting if there are issues. I did reach out to the company I ordered from the day I ordered two different ways and have yet to receive a reply. This interaction has left me with a sour taste, I will not be trusting Shop for recommendations.

title: Great but this refreshing bug is a pain
text: I love Arrive. It‚Äôs so convenient and I adore that it pulls the tracking information from my emails without me having to manually input them. title: Lacking some features
text:
Other tracking apps have the ability to swipe left from the home screen to mark a delivery archived or delete it.  This app does not and it‚Äôs time consuming to open every delivery to and then click again for what you want to do.  This action isn‚Äôt new but ‚ÄúShop‚Äù fails to see a good user experience as a priority. 

Not being able to delete the shops you are following is frustrating.  It will have shops in there that are erroneous or you have no desire to follow.  The app fails to allow you to do anything with the list which negates it‚Äôs value.  If you purchase one off item from multiple vendors they are all on the list and the important ones you care about go neglected due to the length of the list.  It is so annoying I will never even look at that Part of the app again. 

It does track easily but the entire experience is lacking a positive customer experience.
